articles.title: “Serial” moves away from exploring extraordinary cases
articles.description: The producers of the hit podcast spend over a year in the courtrooms of Cleveland, Ohio—“the least exceptional” place in America
articles.content: SERIAL is to podcasts what Game of Thrones is to television. The release of new episodes is a much-anticipated event; fans binge on it, dissecting clues and offering theories. The first season, released in 2014, is considered the catalyst of the podcast renai… [+5039 chars]

articles.title: Mike Espy versus Cindy Hyde-Smith
articles.description: Will Republicans have 52 or 53 seats in the Senate in January?
articles.content: THE mid-term elections finally come to an end on November 27th, when Mississippians head to the polls to choose a new senator. Cindy Hyde-Smith, whom the states governor appointed to the seat when Thad Cochran resigned in April, faces off against Mike Espy, w… [+2917 chars]

articles.title: The challenges of Japan’s demography
articles.description: How does a country cope if more than half of new babies will be centenarians?
articles.content: JAPAN IS DEALING with an extreme version of the demographic challenges that face many rich countries. In an interview with The Economist, Shinzo Abe, the prime minister, said the population was both declining and ageing at unprecedented speed. The fertility r… [+2936 chars]

articles.title: Russia fires on and seizes Ukrainian vessels
articles.description: Ukraine’s president calls for martial law in response
articles.content: IN DIPLOMACY, building bridges is usually a good thing. But Russias Crimean Bridge, spanning the Kerch Strait between the Sea of Azov and the Black Sea (see map), has been more flashpoint than pacifier since it opened six months ago. On November 25th Russian … [+3714 chars]

articles.title: An alleged chemical attack by rebels threatens a truce in Syria
articles.description: Rebels holed up in Idlib fear Russia and the Assad regime will try to take the province
articles.content: FOR MUCH OF the summer it seemed that a Russian-backed assault on Idlib province, the Syrian rebels last redoubt, was imminent. International observers feared it would be an especially bloody battle, leading to a humanitarian crisis. But diplomacy prevailed i… [+2514 chars]
